program_title: Farm Labor Housing Technical Assistance Grants
what_does_program_do: USDA Rural Development awards grants to nonprofit organizations to provide technical assistance to applicants for Farm Labor Housing (FLH) loans and grants. These loans and grants are used to increase the availability of affordable, decent housing for farm laborers.
program_features_funding_announcement: Announced through a Notice of Funding Availability (NOFA) placed in the Federal Register.
program_features_funding_availability: Grant funds are limited, and are awarded through a competitive process.
use_of_funds_eligible_1: technical assistance provided during the application, underwriting, and closing processes
use_of_funds_eligible_2: assistance with transaction costs associated with the application process, and for other agency-approved consultation, advisory and non-construction services
use_of_funds_not_eligible_2: Transaction costs the FLH loan or grant will fund.
use_of_funds_not_eligible_3: Transaction costs in which an identity of interest – such as between buyer and seller, or owner and lender – exists between grantees and applicants.
governing_program_rule_2_description: Title V of the Housing Act of 1949
for_more_information_contact_instruction: Please contact Multifamily Housing toll-free at 800-292-8293, or visit https://www.rd.usda.gov/multifamily and scroll to the bottom of the page to find the contact for your area.
note_consult_program_instructions_locati: in the section above titled 'What governs this program?'
note_equal_opportunity_statement: USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender.
